instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message: Whats up guys just shoot me quick, green light on charger no liquid damage cpu gets warm, no fan spin 5vs0 3v3s0 is present no known shorts to ground let me guess dead graphics chip should i send to the donor gods or does it have a chance for life again?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message: No fan spin means usually ALL_SYS is not present, check it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 26979"]No fan spin means usually ALL_SYS is not present, check it.[/QUOTE]

100% right Duke 0.050 v at ALL_SYS. I did a compare with a good working board at Q7950 i also replaced Q7950 and have the same result i'm a little confused because the readings are not too far off. Where should i look from here? [TABLE="border: 0, cellspacing: 0"]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message: Measure all rails, one will be missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 27019"]Measure all rails, one will be missing. [/QUOTE]

Thanks for the advice Duke! Mark this one as solved i was missing a rail just as you said. Turns out i was missing PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT which comes from U7300, that was missing MEMVTT_EN signal that comes from Q3250 pin 5. Turns out the MEMVTT_EN_L signal was high due to Q3200 not opening the source to drain replaced Q3200 and bingo fan spin again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another one 820-2915 Cpu Gets Warm No fan Spin
threads.message: Since when does this happen for any reason other than PLT_RESET_L missing? I'm jealous!!
